If there was a maybe option on if I recommended this game, I would chose that. This is why I say this. The game itself is fun and I remember playing it on Xbox360, but what I didn't expect is the games audio to be horrible. No the acting is fine, but the audio loops or lags a lot. It even froze my computer on a file and I own a brand new laptop. What I mean by audio lag is a word will be repeated several times before skipping ahead, unintentionally of course. I understand it is a fairly old game, but please be aware of this issue before buying. I recommend it because another file I have has not crashed yet and is still very much playable.

Te encuentras en la situaci√≥n en la que vas a casa de tu abuela i no hay wifi i por casualidad compraste un juego en verano por 81 c√©ntimos, i que mejor que intentar pasarse √©l juego no?  Yo que me he acabado el juego i sin haber jugado el modo cop, es una joya en todo su esplendor, lo recomiendo a todo el mundo a excepci√≥n de si no tienes paciencia, aunque este juego te puede ayudar a superarla, le cais a dedicar horas, i no seran pocas, ya os digo que es seguro, que os vais a quedar estancados en mas de una sala de pruebas, es uno de los pocps juegos que resalta en todos los aspectos, i si pensais que solo es hacer portales todo el tiempo sin una palabra de un personaje, su humor es incre√≠ble. I esto os lo dice un ludopata de rango 83 que se ha pasado el juego dos veces, (la segunda para oir los comentarios de los desarrolladores) un desafio ya que en esta no puedes guardar partida, despues me vi todps los cortos de Aperture Science i ahora me voy a comprar una camiseta de este juego.
PD: Bendita seas abuelita.

Un muy buen juego y muy buena secuela. La historia ahora si avanza a algun lado, y enlazar esta historia con la de Half Life es un detallito-detallazo que la verdad hace que cualquier fan de Valve ame esta obra.

This has game has been the source of some of my fondest memories with my father. He's not dead, but I remember as a kid having a blast playing through this with him, laughing at all of the voice lines, many of which we still quote. Later on, I played through the multiplayer with several different friends, and overall, this is a great game. Highly reccomend. As if that needed to be said.

I bought this years ago and somehow missed it or ditched it then due to same issue as today and forgot.
I played it today as I was looking for something with local split screen for our Game Nights, the game looks great, but wow, the controller system is shocking! Talk about Valve forcing you to buy a Steam controller - the XBOX ONE controller works after much messing around but its very jumpy and is not an ideal way to play the game - Come on Valve, update the game to work with modern day controllers like every other Dev has too. 
I would love to play more in co-op but the jumpy controller system makes that unlikely tbh. Such a shame!
I have said I do not recommend this game, that is based just on my controllers not working properly - if they were working I think the game would be great.

OK< Big edit on this as we tried it again and everything works fine, I am not sure why, maybe a game update?

Anyway, great fun now it works and brilliant with 2 players split screen :)

Valve had enormous shoes to fill with this game as the original had a fantastic story which worked due to its short length. Fortunately, Valve went above and beyond with this game, because not only did they add new features, but they expanded more on the history of the facility and added new memorable characters and features. The features they added included Thermal Discouragement Beams, Excursion Funnels, Hard Light Bridges, Aerial Faith Plates, different gels with different functions, and several types of cubes. These gameplay elements kept the game fresh and allowed for more diverse puzzles. In addition, I liked how we got to learn about the history of the facility, because while I liked how the original remained ambiguous on its origin, I was also interested in learning more about how Aperture ended up that way. Due to this, I found the middle section really memorable. I also loved Wheatley, because, while comic relief characters can be dodgy, I thought he was hilarious due to his stupidity, so he easily stole the show for me. Cave Johnson was also memorable as, not only was he reminiscent of GLaDOS's quirky humor from the first game, but he was also really charismatic. In addition, the ending to this game is just about as perfect as you can get as it contains a jaw-dropping action sequence and a magnificent final cutscene. This is just the main story I've talked about though. The game comes with other features such as co-op and community test chambers. I haven't played the co-op as I haven't found someone to play it with, so I can't comment on that, but I can talk about the community test chambers. Basically, you get to design your own test chambers, publish them, and test ones which other people made. Overall, I'd say the function is fun and easy to use, and I also like seeing what other people create with it. Anyways, I highly recommend this game to all people who liked the first game, because it contains many more merits. It contained everything I was hoping the sequel to have, and then some.
Very Good game 10/10
